module.field:
General Instructions:

  • This template can be used as the Computer System Software Validation / Assurance Report (V/AR) template.
  • Blue text is sample text. Select the appropriate value or remove.
  • Delete or replace all red text in final version. All text must be black in the final version.
  • Black text is required. These topics must be addressed or indicate “not applicable” with a brief rationale.


If the QA environment is released with a report, include only Quality environment deliverables and sections of this document. Use the same report as revision 02 to add Production details. Alternately, QA can be released with a test case that verifies all QA committed deliverables are completed and all testing is ‘Passed’ or ‘Passed with Incident.’

This Validation / Assurance Report summarizes the overall results for the software assurance qualification of the <Computer System Name> performed <by / for / with> Compliance Group. This project was initiated under Change Control ####### and Validation / Assurance Plan, #######, which was created to comply with procedure XXXXXXX, Computer Software Assurance.

This document applies to the <Computer System Name>, Release X.Y, and summarizes the results of all assurance testing phases in <the Quality (QA) / the Quality and Production (PROD) environments. This report demonstrates that the system has been built to specifications, is functionally reliable, performs as needed and is suitable for <release to build a quality Production (PROD) environment / release to end users.>

The <Computer System Name> was deployed to (use a consistent high-level description of the associated business process(es) or intended use; summarize why.) (e.g. deliver a process for controlled review and approval of quality documentation, including procedures, quality tracking records (Nonconformances and CAPAs) and device-controlled drawings and parts records.) Requirements were approved to define the intended use <and system functions /, system functions and build parameters.>

These requirements were assessed for their potential to harm patient safety, degrade product quality and / or compromise data integrity per procedure XXXXXSOP, XXXXXXXXXXX, and based on these risks, tested with a corresponding rigor. All test cases were concluded as <’Passed’ / ‘Passed or ‘Passed with Incident.’> No test cases were concluded with ‘Failed’ status.

A total of ## Deviations were initiated, investigated, resolved and closed. Of the Deviations, ## occurred in the Quality environment, with the remaining ## in Production. Of the Deviations ##% were classified as Low Risk, ##% as Medium, ##% as High and only ##% as Critical. Due to the complexity of the system and the amount of testing completed, this number was deemed acceptable, with no trends noted in their categorization. Taken together, this provides reasonable assurance that the system is functionally reliable and operationally stable.

The Acceptance Criteria, defined in the Validation / Assurance Plan, #########, established all conditions to be satisfied prior to <release to Production / release to end users and closure of the validation phase.> These included all testing activities successfully completed <, and all deviations resolved and closed / all deviations resolved and closed and all lifecycle documentation approved.>

This Validation / Assurance Report for the <Quality environment / Quality and Production environments> demonstrates the acceptance criteria have been successfully met.  <The <Computer System Name> is now released for Production environment build and testing. The <Computer System Name> is suitable for it intended use and is now released to end users and operational support.>

Include any definitions, abbreviations or acronyms used by the system. It is not necessary to include any terms defined in the XXXX series procedures. These should be unique to the computer system, and not commonly recognized. If no definitions are required, write “Not applicable.”

Term Definition
ALM Application Lifecycle Management
BPO Business Process Owner

In this section provide the validation scope. Include major system components or modules, if data migration is involved and any planned exclusions. If Description not used, delete the column and size the table to 100%.

Deliverable
Document No
Version
Description
Supplier Audit Report
#######
01
The software supplier was audited by the Compliance Group Supplier Quality organization. Results were found to conform to requirements as documented in the Audit Report.
Compliance Assessment
#######
01
The Compliance Assessment determined the system was GxP applicable and is required to comply with global electronic records and electronic signatures regulations. This was the rationale to complete the software validation / assurance.
Overall Risk Assessment
#######
01
The Overall Risk Assessment (ORA) determines the potential for a system to impact Patient Safety, Product Quality and Data Integrity. This is then measured against the overall implementation complexity to determine a <Low / Medium / High> system risk rating.
Validation / Assurance Plan (V/AP)
#######
01
The V/AP defined the deliverables that would be created and testing that would be conducted to demonstrate software assurance per procedure.
System Requirements Specification (SRS)
#######
01
The SRS defines the computer system’s intended use, the business processes it automates and the functional behavior to satisfy the system, in addition to any regulatory requirements.
System Requirements Specification (SRS)
#######
02
Each revision should be accounted for.
The SRS was revised to account for a change to the document approvals process the system would be configured to adhere to.
Configuration Specification (CS) / Design Specification (DS)
#######
01
The CS / DS defines the configured parameters to meet Compliance Group’s requirements for approvals workflows.
Functional Risk Assessment
#######
01
The Functional Risk Assessment evaluated system requirements for their potential to harm patient safety, degrade product quality and compromise data integrity. This analysis was used to determine the test assurance level and drive a matched rigor of testing.
Data Migration Plan
#######
01
Data was migrated from the legacy MasterControl system. All extraction, conversion, migration, testing and sampling activities were governed by this Plan.
Data Migration Report
#######
01
Results of the successful data migration are detailed in this report.
Traceability Matrix (TMX)
#######
01
The system TMX maps system requirements to assurance testing and demonstrates no gaps in coverage.
System Description (SYD)
#######
01
A System Description was created to provide an overview of the system, detail associated plans, reports and related procedures.
QA only
Validation / Assurance Report (V/AR)
#######
01
The V/AR details the qualification and assurance activities to demonstrate the computer system QA environment was built to specifications and functions as intended.
QA and PROD
Validation / Assurance Report (V/AR)
#######
This document
The V/AR details the qualification and assurance activities to demonstrate the computer system QA environment was built to specifications and functions as intended, that Production has been qualified and the system is suitable for release to end-users.
System Inventory
#######
08
The Compliance Group computer system inventory was revised to add pertinent details for this computer system.

Adapt to the project as needed.

The following procedures that support the use and support of the <Computer System Name> system were <created / revised>.

Title / Topic
Document No.
Version
Access and Security


Archival and Retrieval


Business Continuity Plan


Disaster Recovery Plan


Change Management


Document Control


Help Desk / Incident Reporting


Production Problems


Retirement


System Administration


Training


Business Process Standard Operating Procedure(s)

Test Case ID
Added / Removed
Risk / Rationale
TS-AGL-OQ-009
Removed
Test case was initially planned to address the widget functionality. However, during test case development, it was determined better suited for inclusion in test case TS-AGL-OQ-002.



A total of ## Deviation Reports were initiated during validation / assurance of the <Computer System Name>. All deviations were investigated, resolved, dispositioned and closed.

Incidents were broken-down by type and risk classification. The main type of risk was user related, representing ##% of the total. The majority of risk classifications were <Low / Medium / High / Critical>, representing ##% of the total. No significant trends were noted in the incident analysis.

The following items were defined by the <Computer System Name> Validation / Assurance Plan, #######, to demonstrate the system is suitable for use.

Provide the status of each deliverable.

This Validation / Assurance may be closed with the following conditions are satisfied.

  • All document deliverables to specify the system’s intended use and function have been created and approved.
  • Data has been successfully migrated to the system.
  • All testing has been completed with ‘Passed’ or ‘Passed with Deviation results.
  • <No deviations were encountered. / All Deviation Reports have been investigated, resolved and closed.>

This section is only used when preparing the final version of the report (or initial if QA and PROD).

The <Computer System Name> validation / assurance was completed per the approved Validation / Assurance Plan, #######, and as governed under Change Control ######. Comprehensive testing, including unscripted and scripted, installation and functional, were successfully executed with <’Passed’ / ‘Passed’ or ‘Passed with Deviation’> results. <## / No> Deviation Reports were initiated, investigated, resolved and closed. The low risk classification of these deviations and the reduced percentage, ##%, in Production suggest system reliability.

With this report all documentation is approved, all testing is successfully concluded, and all deviations are closed. Given these, the <Computer System Name> is deemed suitable for release.

Modify this section if it is for QA or QA and PROD.

The results of this validation / assurance indicate the <Computer System Name> meets the specified requirements defined in the Validation / Assurance Plan. This system, as demonstrated by completion and approval of the specified documents and successful execution of the risk-based testing, satisfies requirements, meets intended use and is suitable for <build of the Production environment /production release>.

<## / No> Deviations were encountered, investigated, resolved and closed. These were analyzed with no trends noted. This system has met all specified requirements, is released and placed under change management.

If none, use “Not applicable.”

XXXXXXX    Compliance Assessment

XXXXXXX    Computer Software Assurance

XXXXXXX    System Requirements Specification

XXXXXXX

Not applicable.     

#documentPanel(true "approved")
